jparsec.io

Class LATEXReport

  • java.lang.Object
    • jparsec.io.LATEXReport
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class LATEXReport
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    A class to generate reports for Latex.

    The basic process is to write the header, to start the body, to end the body, and to end the document. Any text to write should be located inside the body. Anyway, the header/body and document end are handled or called automatically in case the user don't call them, so it is possible to concentrate just in the content.

    Latex report has been designed to be compatible with html reports. If you create an html report, you can also report to latex by just changing the object instance. Some methods are not completely compatible, though.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    T. Alonso Albi - OAN (Spain)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

               int textHeightPercentage)
        Writes the header of the Latex file.
        Parameters:
        title - Title to be seen in the document.
        textWidthPercentage - Percentage of the page width ocupped by text, from 0 to 100.
        textHeightPercentage - Percentage of the page height ocupped by text, from 0 to 100.

      • writeHeader

        public void writeHeader(java.lang.String documentType,
               java.lang.String title,
               java.lang.String author,
               java.lang.String date,
               java.lang.String[] packages)
        Writes the header of the Latex file with an author. Not compatible with HTML.
        Parameters:
        documentType - Document type. Set to null to use default article.
        title - Title to be seen in the document.
        author - Document author.
        date - Date.
        packages - A set of package names to be imported using usepackage Latex command. Can be null to import no additional one. Default imported packages are graphicx, txfonts, verbatim, hyperref, spanish {babel}, longtable, usenames {color}, natbib.

      • writeHeaderForPresentationUsingBeamer

        public void writeHeaderForPresentationUsingBeamer(java.lang.String theme,
                                         java.lang.String title,
                                         java.lang.String author,
                                         java.lang.String institute,
                                         java.lang.String date,
                                         java.lang.String[] packages,
                                         boolean hideNavigationControls,
                                         boolean showTitlePage,
                                         boolean forceSmallNavigationBar,
                                         java.lang.String leftMargin,
                                         java.lang.String rightMargin)
        Writes the header of the Latex file for a presentation. Not compatible with HTML.
        Parameters:
        theme - The theme name, or null to use Warsaw.
        title - Title to be seen in the document.
        author - Document author.
        institute - The institute.
        date - Date.
        packages - A set of package names to be imported using usepackage Latex command. Can be null to import no additional one. Default imported packages are graphicx, txfonts, verbatim, hyperref, spanish {babel}, longtable, usenames {color}, natbib.
        hideNavigationControls - True to hide navigation controls.
        showTitlePage - True to include the first frame showing a default presentation title.
        forceSmallNavigationBar - True to force the navigation bar to show just one section and subsection (the current one).
        leftMargin - Left margin as a value in cm for the text location. Null for default value.
        rightMargin - Right margin as a value in cm for the text location. Null for default value.

      • writeRowInTable

        public void writeRowInTable(java.lang.String[] columns,
                   java.lang.String bgcolor,
                   java.lang.String align,
                   java.lang.String colspan)
        Write a row in a table.

        Align commands are right, left, center.

        Column span is the number of columns to be agruped by a given text. If a table has 6 columns (length of columns array), then a column span of 6 alows to write text ocuping the whole row, as a title for example. In this case the columns array should have length 1 to write only that title.

        Parameters:
        columns - Columns to be written to complete the row.
        bgcolor - Background color. Ignored, only for compatibility with HTML report.
        align - Align command. Set to null to use default left align.
        colspan - Column span command. Set to null to skip the command.

      • writeRowsInTable

        public void writeRowsInTable(Table table)
                      throws JPARSECException
        Writes an entire table object, row by row. Header should be written previously. The table is written using parenthesis for the error values, and without units. Parameters like background color and align are ignored.
        Parameters:
        table - The table object.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - In case the number of dimensions in the Table is more than 2.

      • writeRowInTable

        public void writeRowInTable(java.lang.String[] columns,
                   java.lang.String bgcolor,
                   java.lang.String align,
                   java.lang.String colspan,
                   boolean format)
        Write a row in a table.

        Align commands are right, left, center.

        Column span is the number of columns to be agruped by a given text. If a table has 6 columns (length of columns array), then a column span of 6 alows to write text ocuping the whole row, as a title for example. In this case the columns array should have length 1 to write only that title.

        Parameters:
        columns - Columns to be written to complete the row.
        bgcolor - Background color. Ignored, only for compatibility with HTML report.
        align - Align command. Set to null to use default left align.
        colspan - Column span command. Set to null to skip the command.
        format - True to format text with the current style and color.

      • writeRowInTable

        public void writeRowInTable(java.lang.String[] columns,
                   java.lang.String[] title,
                   java.lang.String bgcolor,
                   java.lang.String align,
                   java.lang.String colspan,
                   boolean format)
        Write a row in a table including a possible title (tooltip text) that appears when the mouse is on the text item.

        Align commands are right, left, center.

        Column span is the number of columns to be agruped by a given text. If a table has 6 columns (length of columns array), then a column span of 6 alows to write text ocuping the whole row, as a title for example. In this case the columns array should have length 1 to write only that title.

        Parameters:
        columns - Columns to be written to complete the row.
        title - Title for the tooltip in each column item.
        bgcolor - Background color. Ignored, only for compatibility with HTML report.
        align - Align command. Set to null to use default left align.
        colspan - Column span command. Set to null to skip the command.
        format - True to format text with the current style and color.

      • writeRowInTable

        public void writeRowInTable(java.lang.String[] columns,
                   java.lang.String[] title,
                   java.lang.String bgcolor,
                   java.lang.String align,
                   java.lang.String colspan)
        Write a row in a table including a possible title (tooltip text) that appears when the mouse is on the text item.

        Align commands are right, left, center.

        Column span is the number of columns to be agruped by a given text. If a table has 6 columns (length of columns array), then a column span of 6 alows to write text ocuping the whole row, as a title for example. In this case the columns array should have length 1 to write only that title.

        Parameters:
        columns - Columns to be written to complete the row.
        title - Title for the tooltip in each column item.
        bgcolor - Background color. Ignored, only for compatibility with HTML report.
        align - Align command. Set to null to use default left align.
        colspan - Column span command. Set to null to skip the command.

      • writeBigSkip

        public void writeBigSkip()
        Writes a blank paragraph, like a big skip (2 cm).

      • writeSmallSkip

        public void writeSmallSkip()
        Writes a blank line, like a small skip (0.5 cm).

      • writeVerticalSkip

        public void writeVerticalSkip(double cm)
        Writes a blank line, like a small skip.
        Parameters:
        cm - The amount of space in cm. 2cm is a big skip, 0.5 a small skip.

      • writeSpace

        public void writeSpace()
        Writes an space in the code, to separate code sections. Not visible in the browser.

      • writeHorizontalLine

        public void writeHorizontalLine()
        Writes an horizontal line.

      • writeImage

        public java.lang.String writeImage(java.lang.String width,
                          java.lang.String height,
                          java.lang.String align,
                          java.lang.String border,
                          java.lang.String alt,
                          java.lang.String src)
        Returns the code for an image tag. None of the parameters can be null.
        Parameters:
        width - Width. As a number for pixels or as percentage.
        height - Height. As a number for pixels or as percentage.
        align - Align.
        border - Border. Ignored
        alt - Alt (tooltip text). Ignored.
        src - Link to the image.
        Returns:
        Latex code.

      • writeImages

        public java.lang.String writeImages(java.lang.String width,
                           java.lang.String height,
                           java.lang.String align,
                           java.lang.String border,
                           java.lang.String alt,
                           java.lang.String[] src)
        Returns the code for an image tag. None of the parameters can be null.
        Parameters:
        width - Width. As a number for pixels or as percentage.
        height - Height. As a number for pixels or as percentage.
        align - Align.
        border - Border. Ignored
        alt - Alt (tooltip text). Ignored.
        src - Link to the image.
        Returns:
        Latex code.

      • writeImageWithCaption

        public void writeImageWithCaption(java.lang.String width,
                         java.lang.String height,
                         java.lang.String align,
                         java.lang.String src,
                         java.lang.String caption,
                         java.lang.String label)
        Writes the code for an image tag. Not compatible with HTML.
        Parameters:
        width - Width.
        height - Height.
        align - Align.
        src - Link to the image.
        caption - Caption for the image. Can be null.
        label - Label as an id for the image. Can be null.

      • writeImageWithCaption

        public void writeImageWithCaption(java.lang.String width,
                         java.lang.String height,
                         java.lang.String angle,
                         java.lang.String align,
                         java.lang.String src,
                         java.lang.String caption,
                         java.lang.String label)
        Writes the code for an image tag. Not compatible with HTML.
        Parameters:
        width - Width.
        height - Height.
        angle - Rotation angle of the image in degrees, or null.
        align - Align.
        src - Link to the image.
        caption - Caption for the image. Can be null.
        label - Label as an id for the image. Can be null.

      • writeImagesWithCaption

        public void writeImagesWithCaption(java.lang.String width,
                          java.lang.String height,
                          java.lang.String angle,
                          java.lang.String align,
                          java.lang.String[] src,
                          java.lang.String caption,
                          java.lang.String label)
        Writes the code for a set of images. Not compatible with HTML.
        Parameters:
        width - Width. Can be null.
        height - Height. Can be null.
        angle - Rotation angle of the image in degrees, or null.
        align - Align.
        src - Links to the images.
        caption - Caption for the image. Can be null.
        label - Label as an id for the image. Can be null.

      • getCode

        public java.lang.String getCode()

        Returns:
        Latex code.

                                        boolean alsoSize)

        Parameters:

        alsoSize - True to get also the code with the current text size.
        Returns:
        LATEX code.

      • compileLatexToDVI

        public static java.lang.String compileLatexToDVI(java.lang.String path)
        Compile a latex file to a dvi file. 3 consecutive compilations are performed to avoid problems, and previous temporal files .aux, .log, .dvi, .out, .toc, .idx, .bbl, and .blg are deleted.
        Parameters:
        path - Path to a .tex file.
        Returns:
        Output log from command.

      • deleteTemporalFiles

        public static void deleteTemporalFiles(java.lang.String path)
        Delete temporal files (.aux, .log, .dvi, .out, .toc, .idx, .blg, .bbl).
        Parameters:
        path - Path to the .tex file.

      • compileLatexToPS

        public static java.lang.String compileLatexToPS(java.lang.String path)
                                         throws JPARSECException
        Compile a latex file to create a Postscript file.
        Parameters:
        path - Path to a .tex file.
        Returns:
        Path to the resulting ps file.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • compileLatexToPDF

        public static java.lang.String compileLatexToPDF(java.lang.String path)
                                          throws JPARSECException
        Compile a latex file to create a PDF file directly using pdflatex.
        Parameters:
        path - Path to a .tex file.
        Returns:
        Path to the resulting pdf file.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • compileLatexToDVIAndThenPDF

                                                    throws JPARSECException

        Parameters:
        path - Path to a .tex file.
        Returns:
        Path to the resulting pdf file.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • setAvoidFormatting

        public void setAvoidFormatting(java.lang.String toAvoid)
        Sets the set of characters to preserve as the user types then without reformating. See formatSymbols(String) for list of symbols. Default symbols to avoid formatting are \{}~.
        Parameters:
        toAvoid - Set of characters to preserve without reformatting.

      • getAvoidFormatting

        public java.lang.String getAvoidFormatting()
        Returns the characters that should not be formatted.
        Returns:
        Characters to preserve.

      • formatSymbols

        public java.lang.String formatSymbols(java.lang.String text)
        Replaces normal symbols by it's Latex representation. Currently only for <, >, , , , , , +/-, {, }, _, ^, ~, \, $, #, %, &, , . Any of them can be preserved in the input by adding the character to setAvoidFormatting(String). Default symbols to avoid formatting are \{}~.
        Parameters:
        text - Input text.
        Returns:
        Output table.

      • format

        public static java.lang.String format(java.lang.String text)
        Replaces normal symbols by it's Latex representation. Currently only for <, >, , , , , , +/-, {, }, _, ^, ~, \, $, #, %, &, , . Default symbols to avoid formatting are \{}~.
        Parameters:
        text - Input text.
        Returns:
        Output table.

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        For unit testing only.
        Parameters:
        args - Not used.
